description: Mid 15thc., Middle English werefare, from Middle English werre (“war”) +‎ fare (“journey, going”), equivalent to war +‎ fare.

entries.meaning: The waging of war or armed conflict against an enemy.
examples: The Philistines gathered their armies together for warfare, to fight with Israel.

entries.meaning: Military operations of some particular kind e.g. guerrilla warfare.

verbs.description: warfare (third-person singular simple present warfares, present participle warfaring, simple past and past participle warfared)

entries.meaning: To lead a military life; to carry on continual wars.
